entry.title: The Great Shift to Self-Custody: 800,000 BTC Worth Over $20 Billion Pulled From Exchanges in 3 Years
entry.summary:
Over the past three years, there‚Äôs been a notable movement in bitcoin holdings. Since September 1, 2020, a whopping 804,000 bitcoin, equivalent to $20.79 billion, has been pulled from centralized exchanges. Notably, 184,000 BTC of that sum, valued at $4.75 billion, was withdrawn in just the last three months.
Billions in Bitcoin Withdrawn from Centralized Exchanges Amid Rising Self-Custody Trend
Centralized exchanges are holding significantly fewer bitcoins (BTC) than they did three years ago. Cryptoquant.com data reveals that on September 1, 2020, trading platforms had a reserve of 2.828 million BTC. Fast forward roughly three years, and that number has dwindled to 2.024 million, marking a decrease of 804,000 BTC. Although BTC holdings on exchanges have consistently decreased over the‚Ä¶

entry.title: Global Interest In Crypto At Near 5-Year Low
entry.summary:
The global Google search traffic for the organic term ‚Äúcryptocurrency‚Äù is at the lowest point in five years, reflecting a shift in user sentiment. Even though prices of top crypto assets, including Bitcoin, are way above 2018 lows at spot rates, market participants appear apprehensive as interest fizzles.¬†
Interest In Bitcoin, Ethereum, And Cryptocurrency Falling
Typically, crypto users closely monitor sentiment indicators, including Google Trends data, to gauge overall interest. Analyzing search data can provide valuable insights into how the broader audience perceives and interacts with digital assets. Rapid changes in search trends, as is currently the case, can signal changes in sentiment, which often directly impact supply and demand market forces.

entry.title: Binance CEO Bullish Prediction: DeFi To Outperform CeFi In Upcoming Market Rally
entry.summary:
Binance CEO Changpeng ‚ÄòCZ‚Äô Zhao made a confident assertion last July that decentralized finance, commonly referred to as DeFi, is poised to rise above centralized finance, or CeFi, in terms of prominence and significance within the financial landscape. According to his forward-looking perspective, this transformative shift is expected to materialize over the course of the next six years.
Zhao pointed out a recent rise in institutional interest in cryptocurrencies, seeing it as a validation of the industry and its technology. He believes that if even a small portion of the trillions of dollars controlled by institutional investors in the equity market were invested in crypto assets, it would significantly boost the cryptocurrency market‚Äôs growth.
Binance Boss Upbeat About DeFi Dominatio‚Ä¶

entry.summary:
The French body overseeing the protection of personal data has carried out ‚Äúchecks‚Äù at the Paris office of Worldcoin. The news of the French inspections comes amid heightened regulatory pressure on the cryptocurrency project co-founded by the current chief executive of Chatgpt developer Openai.
French Data Protection Agency Visits Worldcoin Office as Part of Probe
The National Commission on Informatics and Liberty of France, known by its French abbreviation, CNIL, has carried out ‚Äúchecks‚Äù at the Worldcoin‚Äôs office in the country‚Äôs capital this week, Reuters reported. These come when the crypto firm finds itself under increased global regulatory scrutiny.
CNIL is France‚Äôs independent watchdog tasked to ensure that the French data privacy law is applied to the collection, storage, and ‚Ä¶

entry.title: August Crypto Startup Funding Hits 2-Year Low: Below $500 Million ‚Äì Report
entry.summary:
Crypto startups faced a startling setback in August as venture funding plummeted to less than $500 million, marking the lowest point in over two years, according to data from The Block Research.
This decline marks the fourth consecutive month of dwindling venture funding volumes in the crypto space, reflecting a stark contrast to the exuberant investments witnessed in recent years.
Venture capitalists are adopting a more cautious approach, demonstrating a noticeable shift in sentiment. Tom Schmidt, managing partner at crypto VC firm Dragonfly, noted in a report that investors are taking their time, carefully selecting promising projects while being mindful of the exuberant valuations that characterized the market in previous years.¬†
Many startups that raised enormous sums at infla‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bitwise Retracts Bitcoin and Ether Market Cap Weight Strategy ETF Registration
entry.summary:
In a recent submission to the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), Bitwise has decided to retract its registration for its Bitcoin and Ether Market Cap Weight Strategy exchange-traded fund (ETF). The reasoning behind this action remains unknown, but Bitwise‚Äôs chief legal officer, Katherine Dowling, briefly noted that the company has postponed plans to launch the fund.
Bitwise Halts Plans for Bitcoin and Ether Market Cap Weight Strategy ETF Launch
Subsequent to the postponement of seven spot bitcoin ETFs, Bitwise Asset Management has rescinded its Bitcoin and Ether Market Cap Weight Strategy ETF, as stated in an SEC filing on August 31, 2023. The digital asset manager submitted the fund to the SEC on August 3, 2023. It relies on a five-year-diluted market cap among other quali‚Ä¶

entry.title: Robinhood to Buy Back SBF‚Äôs Stake for Over $605 Million
entry.summary:
Online broker Robinhood is going to buy back the stake purchased by a company of crypto exchange FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried (SBF). The fintech intends to pay $605.7 million for the shares that were transferred to the custody of the U.S. government after the bankruptcy of SBF‚Äôs businesses.
Robinhood to Proceed With Planned Buyback of Shares From USMS
Online stock and crypto brokerage Robinhood Markets announced on Friday it had entered into a stock repurchase agreement with the United States Marshals Service (USMS) for shares acquired by crypto entrepreneur Sam Bankman-Fried‚Äôs Emergent Fidelity Technologies.
The stock was seized after FTX and Emergent filed for bankruptcy in 2022 and later transferred to the custody of the U.S. government, Reuters noted in a report. The collapse of‚Ä¶

Former SEC Chief Says Approval of Spot Bitcoin ETFs Inevitable
Former U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) Chair Jay Clayton offered his perspectives on the likelihood of the securities regulator approving a spot bitcoin exchange-traded fund (ETF) in an interview with CNBC on Friday. The interview followed the SEC delaying its decisions on several bitcoin ETF applications, including one proposed by Blackrock, the world‚Äôs largest asset manager.

entry.title: Ripple Lawyer, Coinbase CLO Believe SEC‚Äôs Interlocutory Appeal Will Get Rejected
entry.summary:
The battle between the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and Ripple Labs over the regulatory status of XRP took a dramatic turn last week. The latest powerplay? A Hail Mary interlocutory appeal from the authority. The agency tried appealing a past court decision allowing Ripple to use a ‚Äúfair notice‚Äù defense. However, prominent lawyers vehemently oppose this, predicting its inevitable rejection.
Ripple‚Äôs chief counsel, James K. Filan, and Coinbase CLO Paul Grewal already called the SEC‚Äôs bluff. In their view, the rigid standards for an interlocutory appeal still need to be met. These mid-case appeals only proceed if waiting for a final verdict would cause ‚Äúirreparable harm.‚Äù According to Filan, the agency has yet to prove this harm exists.¬†
The lawyer forecasted a quick reject‚Ä¶

Kennedy Jr. (RFK Jr.) has explained that China does not want a war with the U.S. However, he warned that China wants to ‚Äúbury‚Äù the U.S. economically. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not afraid of the United States competing with China head to head and countries around the world. I think that‚Äôs good for us. I think we win that competition,‚Äù the presidential hopeful stated.
RFK Jr on China and BRICS Competing With US

Ripple Says Court Should Deny SEC‚Äôs Motion
On Friday, Ripple Labs filed its response to the motion by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to certify an interlocutory appeal. The securities watchdog is seeking to appeal the ruling by District Judge Analisa Torres regarding the ‚Äúprogrammatic‚Äù offers and sales of XRP over crypto trading platforms and Ripple‚Äôs ‚Äúother distributions.‚Äù The regulator also seeks to stay the district court proceedings.
The Ripple legal team wrote:

entry.title: Study Shows Fastest Growing L2 Blockchains Adopt Users in Weeks, Not Months
entry.summary:
The newest layer two (L2) blockchains are being adopted at record speeds, with some reaching one million users within weeks rather than months, according to a study by Coingecko.
L2 Blockchains Hit One Million Users Faster Than Ever, Coingecko Study Shows
A layer two (L2) blockchain runs alongside an existing blockchain like Ethereum to improve transaction speeds and reduce fees. The Ethereum network now has several popular L2 solutions, but they haven‚Äôt always seen rapid adoption. Coingecko recently published a report on the subject which highlights the growth of today‚Äôs top L2s.
Arbitrum, an ETH-based L2, took 303 days to reach one million unique addresses after its mainnet launch on August 31, 2021, according to Coingecko‚Äôs contributor Shaun Paul Lee. The L2 solution Optimism, lau‚Ä¶

entry.title: Defi Sector Navigates an Extended Crypto Winter: TVL Dips to February 2021 Levels
entry.summary:
The realm of decentralized finance (defi) is grappling with the aftermath of the sweeping crypto market slump that marked the close of August. As it stands, the total value locked (TVL) in defi, pegged at $37.59 billion, has plummeted to a low last witnessed in the second week of February 2021.
Crypto Winter‚Äôs Grip on Defi: TVL Stumbles to $37 Billion
The total value locked in defi is on a steady decline, and as of September 1, 2023, it‚Äôs teetering at roughly $37.59 billion. Rewinding to February 9, 2021, this was the last time the TVL stood at such a level, right before it surged to its record peak.
By May 11, 2021, it swelled to an impressive $121 billion, and by November 8, 2021, it soared to a staggering $178 billion. Although there was a brief resurgence to $161 billion on April‚Ä¶

entry.title: China‚Äôs Cryptocurrency Verdict: Legal Property Or Trouble Ahead?
entry.summary:
Cryptocurrency has long been a contentious subject in China, with the government imposing strict regulations and outright bans on various aspects of the industry. However, a recent report from China‚Äôs People‚Äôs Court challenges this historical stance, offering newfound recognition to virtual assets as legal property.
In a significant departure from conventional policy, the report titled ‚ÄúIdentification of the Property Attributes of Virtual Currency and Disposal of Property Involved in the Case‚Äù asserts that virtual assets possess economic attributes that categorize them as property.¬†
This revelation cited in a report from a local publication is a remarkable departure from China‚Äôs blanket ban on foreign digital assets, asserting that individual-held virtual assets should enjoy legal prot‚Ä¶

Can NFTs Rally in September? Recent 3-Week Sales Trend Casts Doubt
Cryptoslam.io reports that in the past week, NFT sales have seen a 10.71% decline, while the volume of NFT transactions has fallen by 17.15% compared to the previous week. Interestingly, the number of NFT purchasers surged, showing a 20.35% increase from the week before. entry.title: Ripple Pushes Back Against SEC‚Äôs Appeal Request With New Court Filing
entry.summary:
In its latest court filing, the legal team representing Ripple Labs ‚Äì the company behind the XRP token ‚Äì argued that the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) doesn‚Äôt have the grounds to request an appeal.
This comes as the SEC looks to dispute Ripple‚Äôs partial victory after Judge Annalisa Torres ruled ‚Äì in July ‚Äì that XRP doesn‚Äôt classify as a security when sold to retail investors.¬†
In its interlocutory appeal, the commission stated that an appeal was merited ‚Äúbecause they involved controlling questions of law as to which there are substantial grounds for difference of opinion.‚Äù
Ripple Calls For Denial Of SEC‚Äôs Request To Appeal Or Stay
On Friday, September 1, Ripple‚Äôs lawyers stated in a new filing to the US District Court for the Southern District of New York t‚Ä¶

entry.title: Biggest Movers: Ton 10% Higher on Saturday, Hitting Highest Level Since May
entry.summary:
Toncoin was easily one of the biggest movers in crypto markets to start the weekend, as price rose by over 10%. Saturday‚Äôs surge comes despite the global market cap mostly trending lower, having fallen by 0.43% as of writing. XRP was one of the tokens to fall, dropping below a key price floor.
Toncoin (TON)
Toncoin (TON) was a notable mover in today‚Äôs session, as the token rose by as much as 10% on Saturday.
After a low of $1.74 on Friday, TON/USD surged to an intraday peak of $1.95 to start the weekend.
As a result of the move, toncoin climbed to its strongest point since May 24, which was the last time price traded above $2.00.
Today‚Äôs rally comes as the 14-day relative strength index (RSI) rebounded at a floor of 75.00, following a surge above 83.00.
Price strength is deeply overbought, however this has not stopped bulls from continuing to send TON even higher.
This could be a recipe for a bear trap however, with a change in direction almost certainly on the cards in the not too distant future.
XRP
XRP, formerly ripple, was in the red to start the weekend, as the token marginally dropped below a key support point.
XRP/USD fell to a bottom at $0.4886 on Saturday, which comes following a peak at $0.5081 the day prior.
This downturn comes as bears pushed price below a price floor of $0.5100 earlier in the week, with momentum continuing to slip since then.
Ever since the ripple ruling, which saw XRP price spike to an almost two-year high, the token has mostly moved lower.
The RSI is now tracking around a floor of 29.00, which is in the midst of a bear zone. However, should this level hold firm, there could be a reversal next week.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Could XRP jump back above $0.5100 in the coming days? Let us know your thoughts in the comments.

entry.title: Judge Mulls Delaying Bankman-Fried's Court Date Amidst Defense Pleas
entry.summary: The defense for the disgraced crypto founder Sam Bankman-Fried has until September 7 to appeal for a trial postponement.

entry.title: DeFi Deposits on Base Soar as Yield Farmers Plant Aerodrome Harvest
entry.summary: DeFi deposits on the Base network hit a new all-time high thanks to liquidity mining incentives from the decentralized exchange Aerodrome.

entry.title: What are Staking and Lending? The Crypto Investment That Can Earn Interest
entry.summary: In this guide we explain how staking and lending works in cryptocurrencies, their benefits, but also their potential downsides.

entry.title: Mastering NFT Trading - Degen U
entry.summary: Take Degen U's new course, Mastering NFT Trading, and earn an on-chain certificate. A top instructor will help you identify trends, seize the right moment to trade, weed out scams‚Äîand have fun while doing it!

entry.title: Space Nation CEO on Working With 'Independence Day' Director Roland Emmerich
entry.summary: Jerome Wu, CEO of Space Nation, tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the upcoming Space Nation Online game in development and shares details on Space Nation Cofounder Roland Emmerich's role in the project.

entry.title: GAME REVIEW: Champions Arena from Gala Games
entry.summary: Champions Arena is a turn-based fantasy RPG from Gala Games, where characters can become NFTs and crypto can be used to purchase gems, one of the game's synthetic currencies. Decrypt's Kate Irwin takes us inside the game for her thoughts on the fun, mobile-first title.

entry.title: Apex Legends Voice Actor Ben Prendergast on the Future of Gaming
entry.summary: Voice actor Ben Prendergast, who's voiced characters in games like Apex Legends and God of War Ragnarok, shares his opinions on the tech space's history of "bubbles" and whether blockchain gaming has a future.

entry.title: The future of AI Stardom and Robotics with SingularityNET COO Janet Adams and Desdemona
entry.summary: In this interview, SingularityNET COO Janet Adams explains the intricate details that went into creating the Desdemona robot AI from Hanson Robotics and future plans for the AI Diva.

entry.title: Crypto a 'No-Brainer' for Video Games, Says Mino Games CEO
entry.summary: Mino Games CEO Sasha MacKinnon, developer of the upcoming Dimensionals game, tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the studio's approach to digital collectibles.

entry.title: Michael Wagner's 'Controversial Take' on Crypto in Games
entry.summary: At Solana's PlayGG, Star Atlas CEO Michael Wagner shares his "controversial take" on crypto in games, shares the challenges of developing the upcoming scifi game, and how crypto's volatility has changed his perspective with Decrypt's Jason Nelson.

entry.title: Interview: Angelic CEO on Building the Sci-Fi RPG on Solana and Ethereum
entry.summary: Angelic is a sci-fi roleplay game in development that will be free-to-play and offer optional, opt-in crypto features on Solana and Ethereum and a governance token. Metaverse Game Studios CEO and Founder Erkan Bayol tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about how he sees AAA traditional games as Angelic's main competitors and shares his vision for the game.

entry.title: Apex Legends Voice Actor on AI's Impact on Video Games
entry.summary: Ben Prendergast is an actor who has voiced characters like Apex Legends' Fuse, God of War Ragnarok's Tyr, and Patroclus in Hades. But as debates swirl around the use of artificial intelligence in entertainment in light of the SAG-AFTRA and WGA strikes, Prendergast gives Decrypt's Kate Irwin his honest take on the potential use of AI actors in games.

entry.title: Star Atlas CEO on Developing an MMO Game
entry.summary: Decrypt's Jason Nelson speaks with Star Atlas Founder and CEO Michael Wagner about the MMO game's approach to development, marketing, and blockchain integrations.

entry.title: Aurory's Origin Story: How JRPGs Inspired the Games
entry.summary: Decrypt's Jason Nelson talks to Aurory's Head of Marketing and Business Development Michael Natoli about the origins of the Aurory crypto games at the Solana PlayGG event.

entry.title: Parallel TCG: Inside the Sci-Fi Card Game‚Äôs Closed Beta
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin goes hands-on with Parallel‚Äôs closed beta on Windows PC to find out what sets it apart from other crypto card-battlers.

entry.title: Web3 Games Need to Compete with All Games, Says Solana Foundation GM
entry.summary: Solana Foundation's General Manager of Games Johnny Lee tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about Solana's PlayGG conference and shares his take on crypto gaming and the "play-to-earn" concept.

entry.title: Many Early Blockchain Games Were 'Cash Grabs,' Says Twitch Streamer Alliestrasza
entry.summary: "I wrote them off," Twitch streamer Alliestrasza said of her initial thoughts on many early blockchain games. She tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about how her perspective on Web3 games has evolved over time and now sees blockchain games getting significantly better.
